text:
I build interpretable machine learning systems and study social behavior at scale. My work spans methods development and applied projects in public policy and computational social science.

title: About Me
text:
I’m a passionate Research Data Analyst working at the intersection of neuroscience, psychology, and pharmacology. I transform complex datasets into transparent, reproducible insights through R-based pipelines, Quarto documentation, and SPSS analyses. My clear visualizations and concise reports empower both research teams and stakeholders to make data-driven decisions with confidence.



MSc in Applied Neuroscience in Human Development, Leiden University
Premaster Education and Child Studies, Leiden University
BSc in Biopharmaceutical Sciences, Leiden University





Machine Learning
Data Visualization

title: Experience
text:
Erasmus University



Research Assistant · 2023 – 2025

Developed and managed a comprehensive dataset based on international surveys for an Erasmus+ funded project.
Created R-scripts in R-Markdown to document data workflows and present findings.
Conducted statistical analyses, visualized research results, and contributed to international conferences and scientific journals.
Supported open science initiatives by documenting and sharing code on the Open Science Framework (OSF).









Erasmus Medical Center



Research Intern · 2019 – 2020

Developed and managed a comprehensive dataset based on international surveys for an Erasmus+ funded project.
